update.description:
This PR adds a plugin that reports the alignment (difference in position and rotation) between two poses. If the poses are given relative to a model or link then they will move with it.

The output is a `gazebo::msgs::PoseStamped` message on the topic called `<namespace>/misalignment`. The plugin maybe enabled or disabled by sending a message to the topic `<namespace>/enable`. 

The demo world reports the alignment of a drill bit on a drill with a screw head on a mailbox. The gif below shows the position part of the pose change after moving the drill closer to the screw head.

![misalignment_demo.gif](https://bitbucket.org/repo/jgXqbo/images/4034379844-misalignment_demo.gif)
update.title: Misalignment Plugin

content.html: b26d381

content.raw: hm, actually I'm not sure the `Fini` approach will work, since `Plugin.hh` does not declare these functions, so they won't be called before the destructor, my mistake
content.html: hm, actually I'm not sure the Fini approach will work, since Plugin.hh does not declare these functions, so they won't be called before the destructor, my mistake

content.raw: I added the Fini function in c0676fd \(branch `misalignment_plugin_fini`\) and called it from the class destructor. @scpeters if you think is ok, the rest of the PR looks good to me.
content.html: I added the Fini function in c0676fd (branch misalignment_plugin_fini) and called it from the class destructor. @scpeters if you think is ok, the rest of the PR looks good to me.

content.raw: Without being an expert on how to properly shutdown the plugins, sounds to me like 1\) is a more conservative approach since it does a bit more than 2\). I’ll try to implement it.
content.html: Without being an expert on how to properly shutdown the plugins, sounds to me like 1) is a more conservative approach since it does a bit more than 2). I’ll try to implement it.

content.raw: @\_jrivero_ let me know what you think of these options
content.html: @_jrivero_ let me know what you think of these options

content.raw: I think we typically initialize gazebo transport during the `Init` function for physics and sensors classes, but plugins get loaded later, so I think it's ok to do this in the Load function
content.html: I think we typically initialize gazebo transport during the Init function for physics and sensors classes, but plugins get loaded later, so I think it's ok to do this in the Load function

content.raw: ~~I think that is the typical pattern~~
content.html: I think that is the typical pattern

content.raw: I can help with implementing one of these, but I'm not sure if you have a preference @sloretz
content.html: I can help with implementing one of these, but I'm not sure if you have a preference @sloretz

content.raw:
The plugin currently doesn't have a `Fini` function, but it has a `WorldPtr`, so I'm not sure it will be able to tear down properly due to a reference loop. I think there's two options:

1. Add a `Fini` function that resets the `ConnectionPtr` and `SubscriberPtr` first of all so that there won't be any further callbacks, then calls `node->Fini()`, clears `PublisherPtr`s and the `WorldPtr`. I think that might be enough.

2. Use a weak world pointer, and re-order the private data class so that the `ConnectionPtr` and `SubscriberPtr` are at the bottom of the list so that they are destructed first. I think this will work, but I'm not sure if `node->Fini()` still needs to be called in a `Fini` function
content.html:
The plugin currently doesn't have a Fini function, but it has a WorldPtr, so I'm not sure it will be able to tear down properly due to a reference loop. I think there's two options:

  1. Add a Fini function that resets the ConnectionPtr and SubscriberPtr first of all so that there won't be any further callbacks, then calls node->Fini(), clears PublisherPtrs and the WorldPtr. I think that might be enough.

  2. Use a weak world pointer, and re-order the private data class so that the ConnectionPtr and SubscriberPtr are at the bottom of the list so that they are destructed first. I think this will work, but I'm not sure if node->Fini() still needs to be called in a Fini function

content.raw: I left some nitpicky remarks, but they're not really important. I think this is good to merge whether or not those comments are addressed.
content.html: I left some nitpicky remarks, but they're not really important. I think this is good to merge whether or not those comments are addressed.

update.description:
This PR adds a plugin that reports the alignment (difference in position and rotation) between two poses. If the poses are given relative to a model or link then they will move with it.

The output is a `gazebo::msgs::PoseStamped` message on the topic called `<namespace>/misalignment`. The plugin maybe enabled or disabled by sending a message to the topic `<namespace>/enable`. 

The demo world reports the alignment of a drill bit on a drill with a screw head on a mailbox. The gif below shows the position part of the pose change after moving the drill closer to the screw head.

![misalignment_demo.gif](https://bitbucket.org/repo/jgXqbo/images/4034379844-misalignment_demo.gif)
update.title: Misalignment Plugin

content.raw: It doesn't seem necessary to `ASSERT_` in these three tests since there's nothing that would crash the executable if the assertions fail. We should consider using `EXPECT_` instead.
content.html: It doesn't seem necessary to ASSERT_ in these three tests since there's nothing that would crash the executable if the assertions fail. We should consider using EXPECT_ instead.

content.raw: Would it be worth providing a default namespace? Or is the likelihood of collisions too high?
content.html: Would it be worth providing a default namespace? Or is the likelihood of collisions too high?

content.raw: Consider naming this `/debug/target`?
content.html: Consider naming this /debug/target?

content.raw: Should we consider naming this `/debug/reference` instead? Might be a more descriptive name.
content.html: Should we consider naming this /debug/reference instead? Might be a more descriptive name.

content.raw: Shouldn't this be performed during the class's `Init()` function?
content.html: Shouldn't this be performed during the class's Init() function?

content.raw: Nitpick: We should consider adding `const` to these declarations which get initialized right away and never modified.
content.html: Nitpick: We should consider adding const to these declarations which get initialized right away and never modified.

content.raw:
I think we're not checking that it has exactly two pose tags, just that it has at least two and that we use the first two.

1. "Must have **at least** two <pose> tags"

2. add a warning if a third pose tag is detected
content.html:
I think we're not checking that it has exactly two pose tags, just that it has at least two and that we use the first two.

  1. "Must have at least two <pose> tags"

  2. add a warning if a third pose tag is detected

content.raw:
how do you feel modifying the example world so one of the reference poses is expressed in the default world frame?

~~~
diff -r 9c892494f41c worlds/misalignment_plugin_demo.world
--- a/worlds/misalignment_plugin_demo.world     Mon Feb 26 16:29:27 2018 -0800
+++ b/worlds/misalignment_plugin_demo.world     Wed Feb 28 10:41:10 2018 -0800
@@ -105,7 +105,7 @@
     <plugin name="alignmentDrillScrew_1" filename="libMisalignmentPlugin.so">
       <namespace>gazebo/default/drill/alignment_1/</namespace>
       <pose frame="drill::link">-0.004 0.135 0.239 0 -0.1 1.570796</pose>
-      <pose frame="Mailbox::link">.06 -0.1 0.798 0 0 3.14159</pose>
+      <pose>1.06 -0.1 0.798 0 0 3.14159</pose>
       <enable>true</enable>
     </plugin>
     <plugin name="alignmentDrillScrew_2" filename="libMisalignmentPlugin.so">
~~~
content.html:
how do you feel modifying the example world so one of the reference poses is expressed in the default world frame?

diff -r 9c892494f41c worlds/misalignment_plugin_demo.world
--- a/worlds/misalignment_plugin_demo.world     Mon Feb 26 16:29:27 2018 -0800
+++ b/worlds/misalignment_plugin_demo.world     Wed Feb 28 10:41:10 2018 -0800
@@ -105,7 +105,7 @@
     <plugin name="alignmentDrillScrew_1" filename="libMisalignmentPlugin.so">
       <namespace>gazebo/default/drill/alignment_1/</namespace>
       <pose frame="drill::link">-0.004 0.135 0.239 0 -0.1 1.570796</pose>
-      <pose frame="Mailbox::link">.06 -0.1 0.798 0 0 3.14159</pose>
+      <pose>1.06 -0.1 0.798 0 0 3.14159</pose>
       <enable>true</enable>
     </plugin>
     <plugin name="alignmentDrillScrew_2" filename="libMisalignmentPlugin.so">
